	at

	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:129)

sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:183)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:644)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:628)

Did you extract 3.0 final on top of an existing version? That is not supported.
Otherwise, are you sure you download the Eclipse SDK (instead of the Eclipse RCP
SDK)? The Eclipse SDK has more than 80 plugins under the plugins directory. The
RCP has less than 20.

A third case: you have an Eclipse install at a read-only location (as Linux
users usually do) and you had run a previous (3.0 build also installed at a
read-only location. In this case, you would have to run with eclipse -clean for
the first time you run.

Let us know whether your problem has to do with any of these scenarios.

Eclipse SDK <<< no i have downloaded the ecplipse ... without SDK.
the eclipse directory has RW rights.

i downloading the SDK ...
Sorry, but what Eclipse drop did you say you had downloaded?
I do see similar problem on suse linux AMD64 install. Refer bug no 70293
Need further information from originator to be able to investigate.
